length.tooltip: A non-negative absolute or relative length.

percentage.tooltip: A percentage value relative to the width or height of the initial viewport at zoom factor 1.0, for horizontal and vertical lengths respectively. Must be non-negative.

name.tooltip: The used value is calculated from the other property values according to the constraining procedure.

property.percentage: Refer to the width of the initial viewport
property.description: Specifies the minimum width of the viewport that is used to set the size of the initial containing block

property.percentage: Refer to the width of the initial viewport
property.description: Specifies the maximum width of the viewport that is used to set the size of the initial containing block.

This is a shorthand property for setting both min-width and max-width. One <viewport-length> value will set both min-width and max-width to that value. Two <viewport-length> values will set min-width to the first and max-width to the second.

property.percentage: Refer to the height of the initial viewport
property.description: Specifies the minimum height of the viewport that is used to set the size of the initial containing block

property.percentage: Refer to the height of the initial viewport
property.description: Specifies the maximum height of the viewport that is used to set the size of the initial containing block.

property.percentage: Refer to the height of the initial viewport
property.description: This is a shorthand property for setting both min-height and max-height. One <viewport-length> value will set both min-height and max-height to that value. Two <viewport-length> values will set min-height to the first and max-height to the second.

Specifies the initial zoom factor for the window or viewing area. This is a magnifying glass type of zoom. Interactively changing the zoom factor from the initial zoom factor does not affect the size of the initial or the actual viewport.

name.tooltip: The zoom factor is UA-dependent. The UA may use the size of the area of the canvas on which the document is rendered to find that initial zoom factor. See this section for a proposed way of handling auto values for zoom.

number.tooltip: A non-negative number used as a zoom factor. A factor of 1.0 means that no zooming is done. Values larger than 1.0 gives a zoomed-in effect and values smaller than 1.0 a zoomed-out effect.

percentage.tooltip: A non-negative percentage value used as a zoom factor. A factor of 100% means that no zooming is done. Values larger than 100% gives a zoomed-in effect and values smaller than 100% a zoomed-out effect.

property.description: Specifies the smallest allowed zoom factor. It is used as input to the constraining procedure to constrain non-‘auto’ ‘zoom’ values, but also to limit the allowed zoom factor that can be set through user interaction. The UA should also use this value as a constraint when choosing an actual zoom factor when the used value of ‘zoom’ is ‘auto’.

name.tooltip: The lower limit on zoom factor is UA dependant. There will be no minimum value constraint on the zoom descriptor used in the constraining procedure

number.tooltip: A non-negative number limiting the minimum value of the zoom factor.

percentage.tooltip: A non-negative percentage limiting the minimum value of the zoom factor.

property.description: Specifies the largest allowed zoom factor. It is used as input to the constraining procedure to constrain non-‘auto’ ‘zoom’ values, but also to limit the allowed zoom factor that can be set through user interaction. The UA should also use this value as a constraint when choosing an actual zoom factor when the used value of ‘zoom’ is ‘auto’.

name.tooltip: The upper limit on zoom factor is UA dependant. There will be no maximum value constraint on the zoom descriptor used in the constraining procedure

number.tooltip: A non-negative number limiting the maximum value of the zoom factor.

percentage.tooltip: A non-negative percentage limiting the maximum value of the zoom factor.

property.description: Specifies if the zoom factor can be changed by user interaction or not.

name.tooltip: The user can interactively change the zoom factor.
The user cannot interactively change the zoom factor.

property.description: This property is used to request that a document is displayed in portrait or landscape mode. For a UA/device where the orientation is changed upon tilting the device, an author can use this property to inhibit the orientation change.

name.tooltip: The UA automatically chooses the orientation based on the device’s normal mode of operation. The UA may choose to change the orientation of the presentation when the device is tilted.
The document should be locked to portrait presentation.
The document should be locked to landscape presentation.
